P.S. Livejournal is about as worthless as a soap opera

Wow, that's actually a pretty good song... hmh... supprised me; I only looked it up, using LimeWire 4.6 Professional, to see if there existed a song to go along with the whole "I'm still alive" theme.

-Robby "yup still here" Coats

Hello, I'm still alive.  Just lettin' you know.

-Robby "not dead" Coats

Well here I am, still stuck in tekas.  Will I ever get to go home, nobody knows.
Well, here's a list of events since I've been here:

When I arrived here last friday, Kevin picked me up and we went back to the apartment where we met Blake.  I sat around ery exhausted for a while, and then we went out to eat.  We went to On The Border... they still havent told me the border of what.  I had a burrito the size of my face.  I don't think it was actually calld a burrito, but thats what it was... thats what ALL mexican food is; burritos wth different names, as I pointed out to the waitress.  I randomly pointed at things on the menu and asked what they were, and they were all some kind of meat wrapped in some kind of tortilla... crazy mexicans.

The following day Blake took me out for breakfast and to the George Bush library... I did not get to check out a book.  We then went on a small tour of Tekas A&M, but everything was closed, so I didnt et to see much.  Blake took me to see the Century Tree, which, by the way, is the ultimate climbing tree.  Blake, however, would not let me clib it.  Century Tree is an oak tree that is so big it looks like 5 trees if you arent "inside."  It's so big that it cant support its own weight and is growing into the ground all over itself.  After that we met Kevin at the mall for pizza.

Kevin took me out to all the old bars that night... interesting history.  We ate at Freebirds, where I had another burrito, but it was a really really good burrito, so it was ok.  I want to go there again.  People make things out of the foil that their buritos are wrapped in and hang them everywhere.  Aparently it is also the Thunderbirds favorite spot in tekas.

I dont really remember much else.  I was supposed to leave after that... ha, ha, ha.

One of the days I was supposed to be englewood (two days ago) Kevin took me to see the Bonfire Memorial... simply stunning.  If something lke that would have happened at any other school, they might plant a tree.  Not here.  The spirit at this school is beyond description.

Last night we went to Santas Wonderland... a drive trough christmas lights dispaly of about a gabazibblillion lights.  Very nice.

As you can see, the more I type, the less effort I put into it.

Oh, and as for the reason I'm still here... kevin broke my airplane.  I was in the plane, ready to take off and go home, about to start the engine, and ae thought it might be funny if the starter went out... Whaddya know, it did.

-Robby "somebody hates me" Coats

Good evening reader, I am writing to you tonight from Tekas, TX, Texas, USA. Here I am in Texas, and I can't leave because I don't have an F-22. If someone wants to buy me an F-22, I'll love you forever... I won't spend any time with you though, because I'll be in my F-22, but I'll love you. The way things look now, I don't think I'll be out of here 'til Thursday... just in time to miss my final for Capt. Charmichael's class. I talked to him this morning and he is going to let me make it up if I have to miss it. Great guy. Well, I flew out here on Friday morning, crossed the Gulf, stopped in n'Orleans for fuel (where the Atlantic Aviation just gave me a car to drive around town for food), then headed out to College Station. It was starting to get dark about an hour after I left New Orleans and I was headed into an overcast layer, so I called up Houston Center for flight following (just to be safe). Funny story about that, though... about 80miles out of College station, houston center calls me up, "November-2-1-1-Juliet-Alpha, radar service terminated, VFR squak, have a nice flight," and not half a second later I must have gone under a GIANT thunderhead, because I was gaining and losing 100-200 feet every second... I thought my wings were going to be ripped right off. I completely cut my power and was still doing 150mph, it was insane. I descended down to about 200 feet off the trees, at night, to try to escape the turbulance, but it didnt get much better, and now I had to worry about zig zagging around a mess of radio towers, and my friking coumpas light was broke! When I finally got out of that and closer to the airport, the beacon was like a light from god, and then the nice guy in the tower lit up juts my runway really really bright, and I about cried... it was so beautiful. Well, I'm alive, and I have to do it all again. I flew half way across the frikin coutry... holy damn jesus. -Robby "give anything for an F-22" Coats

Gettin ready to fly myself to Tekas tomorrow morning... it's going to be soooo boring.

-Robby "Doesn't even have anyone to talk to for 5 hours" Coats

I went and got checked out in a Grumman Tiger today for the trip out to Tekas on friday. I don't know how much fun it will be , though, because my parents are adimently set aginst me going. They say because I've never flown that far... well when the hell am i supposed to?. Anyway, it really is a neat airplane... fast for that kind of plane, 200mph, and excelent visibility. The trip should take about 5 hours, but I not to terribly sure about that, I still have to plan my course.
There she is, one just for kevin... but it figures this is all the marines woud be flying... I love you kevin! We must do lots of stuff when I come out there, because I'm not coming out there to watch Shrek, or whatever it is you do. -Robby "Want some bang for my buck!" Coats

I'm flying to Tekas in a week to see a cartain poop head and whatshername, and I'm the pilot.  It's going to be frikin awesome.  I'll either be in a Diamond Katana, or a Grumman Tiger depending on how many people come.  And I'm frkin awesome; I flew over the high school today and got there in under 5 minutes... you do that driving from Venice island.
PureMoods = amazing
Jello-o


AyYaiyiHiYaawayYHiiiiYaHiyaaaaaaa



-Robby "You better stay the hell back. NanuNanu." Coats
I'm earning $192 in interest A WEEK on my paypal account.  What can your checking account do for you?

What ravages of spirit 
conjured this temptuous rage 
created you a monster 
broken by the rule of love 
and fate has lead you through it 
you do what you have to do 
and fate has led you through it 
you do what you have to do ... 

and I have the sense to recognize that 
I don't know how to let you go 
every moment with apparitions of your soul 
I'm ever swiftly moving 
trying to escape this desire 
the yearning to be near you 
I do what I have to do 
the yearning to be near you 
I do what I have to do 
and I have the sense to recognize 

that I don't know how 
to let you go 
I don't know how 
to let you go 

a glowing ember 
burning hot 
and burning slow 
deep within I'm shaken by the violence 
of existing for only you 

I know I can't be with you 
I do what I have to do 
I know I can't be with you 
I do what I have to do 
and I have the sense to recognize but 
I don't know how to let you go 
I don't know how to let you go 
I don't know how to let you go

Well yesterday was just jam packed with fun stuff, and by jam packed I actually mean that one fun thing happened, and it was only really fun for me and a little bit of fun for the other two involved. Well heres how it went. Cody and Rickey went to go see that stupid foozball game between the stealers and the dolphins, and on the way back while in Okeechobee city, cody got into a car wreck in which his radiator was obliterated... thats right, I said obliterated. Robby to the rescue. I got a call from Cody around 1 o'clock and he says, "Robby, come get me." And I says, "Holy crap, Cody." I was in Englewood getting ready to go back to Tampa and I was shipping out tons of packages or my ebay business. I had NO time to drive to Okeechobee, and aparently I was the ONLY one who could help them. I guess it takes about 4 hours to drive to where they were from Englewood. Not me. I decided there was only one way to take care of this problem; use my super awesomeness and hop in a plane and fly to Okeechobee county airport. I got there in half an hour, and what a whole buncha' nothing there is on the way there. For navigation I had to find some powerlines, arcadia, a prison, a lake, and finally Okechobee city. The airport was pretty much deserted due to the hurricane, so when I landed, I just pulled right up next to Rickey and Cody and the building by which they were standing. We loaded the plane and flew off into the sunset, with a full moon behind us. It got really dark on the way home, so all I could do was pick a heading and follow it, without any ground references, and wait til I hit the coast line. Of course, it worked out fine, I hit the coast and followed it up to Venice municipal. So I flew a rescue mission. It was fun. -Robby "super awesome" Coats
And there she goes, the love of my life. ...Please remember me. -Some lonely, heartbroken fool.
I love bagpipes.  The just "fit."  Their music can describe any emotion.

Well, this week I will receive my second endorsement from Erik, meaning that I will be able to just go rent airplanes whenever I want without an instructor present. This is exactly what I am going to do on the 22nd, so everyone needs to come to my house and watch me fly over... AT OVER 100 MILES PER HOUR AND 50 FEET ABOVE THE TREES WOOOOOOOOO!!!! I'd like to show everyone a "slip" too, which is flying SIDEWAYS. If it's a good day and I feel good, maybe I'll do some more crazy stuff. Hey, Lyndsay, since you so enjoyed my "performance" at the beach, wait 'til you see this. Whoever will not be in attendance, I am going to "slip" over your house. Hurray for Erik!




Hurray for Hootie! He's drunk! And it's only 1 o'clock!

Then post this to your journal and see what people remember of you."

I went to Mr. Lemon Bay wit Tarra, Sheamus, Christie, Lyndsay, "Bill", and Randall.  Wesley Kokomoor should have won... he definitely should have received Most Tallented.

DoooBaLeDoooooooooooooooooo!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

-Love Robby

P.S. Yours is coming, Sheamus, yours is coming...

Solo cross country on sunday morning!  Check ride in a month!  Yay!
I have also been employed by Jon Essenberg to take some aerial photographs of Buchans Landing... maybe I could start a business?
Im getting certified to dive really soon, and if I can do that before Heather and Mike go the keys, I'm going to fly them down there and go diving with them.
Well, summer vacation is almost over... alas.

-Robby "I can't say it enough, hoo-frikin-ray for flying... there's nothing better in the world." Coats

Hurray for flying, and hurray for getting a few of your good friends together to recruit people on middle beach to stand in the formation of a smiley on the ground while I fly over and take a picture. This all happened last saturday, so Im sorry this is late. Anyways, heres how the course of events went: 11:00AM: I arrive at middle beach, shovel in hand, pick a nice open spot, and begin to outline a giant smiely face 11:20AM: Some old lady who goes to the beach to get away from children yells at me for digging. Idiot. Of course I was not bothering her in any way shape or form. 11:30AM: Mike and Rickey arive to help outline the smiley... well, Mike arrives to help outline, and Rickey arrives to point out all the pretty ladies. 11:40AM: We split up and begin walking the beach advertising out project. "Excuse me, floks, would you be interested in standing in the shape of a giant smiley face while I fly overhead and take a picture between 12:30 and 12:45?" 11:41AM: Rickey's foot is killing him 11:50AM: Oh my goodness, Im going to be late. Tarra and Lyndsay arive just as Im leaving... Randall shows up a few minutes later. 11:52AM: I speed like Ive never speed before to the airport. The gang continues recruting. 12:35PM: I begin taxing to the runway. I signal mike via AT&T wireless text messaging service to start running up and down the beach yelling for everyone that was recruited to move into position. 12:40PM: "Venice traffic, Cessna 26-Lima departing runway 4, Venice traffic." I am finally in the air. I depart the pattern to the south and head towards Middle Beach, getting pictures along the way 12:45PM: I begin circling over the beach, and no one is there... mission failed. 12:46PM: Wait, wait... there is activity... there are little ants making their way toward a common point curiously close to the smiley outline 12:46.5PM: Those arent ants, theyre people!!! HURRAY! the beach is beginning to smile!!! 12:47PM: I begin making multiple passes and taking as many pictures as I can... but, sadly, I dropped my camera... 12:47PM: OH MAN! APRIL FOOLS! I take pictures, but sadly, for real this time, only enough people show up to make the smile and the eyes... no outline... but rickey makes up for that by standing out as the nose. Randall flips me the bird. 12:50PM: 1000' is far too high to get good pictures, so, legal or not (im really not sure), I go wings vertical and dive 600' at damn near 3000 fpm. I later find out that I scared the shit out of Lyndsay "He's falling... HES FALING! HES FALLING!!!" she screams. Tarra tells her it's OK. Yeah, c'mon, I was just having fun. 12:57PM: Well, I have my pictures... mission accomplished. Everyone on the ground is getting bored and they begin to disperse. i go do other things. Well, there you have it, folks. The picutes are very very large but well worth the look, so instead of putting them here, I have links to them. Please go check them out. The gang are all in the right eye... and nose. Pic1 Pic2 Pic3 Pic4 Pic5 Pic6 Pic7 Pic8 Pic9
Why shouldn't things turn out bad....

One week left until spring break.  Yay.
Hurray for flying, hurray for Florida Jets 2004, hurray for not having any money, hurray for court, hurray for depression...
Breakfast at ten.  Class at three.

-Robby "Hurray for my Joe comics, and I will never EVER use "lol" or "my bad" in context." Coats

All of the conversations suggest that everything should be good and happy. I can't lie to myself, though... I am still crying... and I still have a lot more painful questions that need to be answered. How could this have ever happened, if not for me... it will always be my fault. If I had not been so sensitive to the fact that she thought this was a good idea, I would have stopped it long before it happened... I was on the verge of saying what I thought... that our seperation was a bad idea... then didn't. I am still the only cause of my pain... and hers. ...Why didn't I say the things I needed to say How could I let my Angel get away Now my world is just a'tumblin' down I can see it so clearly, but you're nowhere around... I have a certain scrapbook now... it is currently the most precious thing in the world to me. -Robby "I've started writing music... I'm in bad shape" Coats P.S. I'm sorry... I'm sure everyone hates these posts over and over again. I just have no other way to let things out than to try and put them into words. I'm putting my heart on the paper for all to examine.

Love. You Truly Desire Love. You long for someone
to hold you and take the pain away. You haven't
been in much relationships or you need to work
on how to handle them. You always seem lost in
a daydream about the person you care about
most.

PLEASE RATE

Still crying... and filled with a silent rage...
I feel as though I have been robbed in some way...

-Robby

This is never going to end, no matter what I do, no matter what decisions I make. If he ever goes near her again... I'll kill him. -Robby "They spun a we----b fo--r me... They spun a we---b fo--r me..." Coats

Well, I'm sad.  Beyond consolation, and reconciliation.  The hole is about as deep as it gets right now.
Perhaps my melancholy personality stems from a subconscious desire to be sad.  Sad is a very complex emotion; I can see why I might enjoy it... but I don't enjoy it... at least not consciously.  At the same time, though, in this depression, I am happy... and grateful.  For this state of mind?  No.  But, I am grateful.


-Robby "Finding more life in dream, more dream in life, and beautiful music holding it all together..." Coats

I just go t back from Wal-Mart over here on Fletcher.  Holy shit.
I am beyond words, amazement, exasperation, and consolation.

-Robby "I am far too amazed, exasperated, and angered to insert anything witty here. " Coats

Im going to start making more items for the Robby Store, so keep up with that.  For all of you who have lived outside of englewood recently for school, you will all appreciate my "newest line."

I find myself running a whole hella lot these days, super early in the morning...  What the hell is wrong with me...

See the song?  What a damn good song.  I love Sammy Kershaw.

I go to court for my speeding tickets at the end of the month.  Boy oh boy, how little they know...  "Ah show you, tickets!"

I ate some yogurt.  It was good.  Mike doesn't like yogurt... sissy.

I have set a serious goal for my self... To become a millionare before I get out of college.  Earn lots of money some way or another the first two years, then nothing but Futures Options the last two years.  Fool proof.

Opening an FA Airsoft field at my house.  $10-15 to play I think.  There's a money magnet right there.

I have lots of phone calls to make of a business nature.  No fun.



-Robby "Im in a very bland mood" Coats

Well, hurray for TJ Merry being locked up for 1st degree murder.  If I've said it once, I'll say it a thousdand times:  "You have to watch out for the ones who, when asked what a tooth brush is, they reply, 'huh?'"


-Robby "I always knew he was trouble... why?  Because his teeth were 5 times the thickness of mine and orange."  Coats

Well, I got up rediculously early this moring to go get the hell beat out of me for ROTC, then came back and had my Post Hell Nap.

Anyway, the important event today was that I went to Rickey's at 4:00 just like he told me to, but he wasnt there.  Seems that some ass hole had to go ruin my day with my friend Rickey by threatening to jump off of Rickey's dorm... yeah...  So rickey got kicked out of the building for 6 friggin hours and was unable to meet me, as I was sitting in the parking lot for an hour waiting for him and wondering why the hell there were 88237658972582 police cars, a "Tactical Response Team," and an ambulance sitting outside.  Anyway, it ends up that he didn't jump... he was talked down.  Ain't that the way it always ends.  Well, I left.  End of story.  Asshole "jumper"... ruin my day... bastard.

-Robby "I woulda' pushed him off" Coats

You are one of the few out there whose wings are truly ANGELIC. Selfless, powerful, and divine, you are one blessed with a certain cosmic grace. You are unequalled in peacefulness, love, and beauty. As a Being of Light your wings are massive and a soft white or silver. Countless feathers grace them and radiate the light within you for all the world to see. You are a defender, protector, and caretaker. Comforter of the weak and forgiver of the wrong, chances are you are taken advantage of once in awhile, maybe quite often. But your innocence and wisdom sees the good in everyone and so this mistreatment does not make you colder. Merciful to the extreme, you will try to help misguided souls find themselves and peace. However not all Angelics allow themselves to be gotten the better of - the Seraphim for example will be driven to fighting for the sake of Justice and protection of those less powerful. Congratulations - and don't ever change - the world needs more people like you. Claim Your Wings

Well, time to go back to tampa this evening.  I hate tampa.
Hmmm... life is strange.  Its really strange the way things are going, and its really strange that everbody understands what is going on, but noone can do anything about it.
Some interesting things happened while I was here that I need not go into detail about, but the future is looking good... we'll just say that I purchased a little something at curcuit city.  I suppose now it is just a race against time.

I went for my longest flight in a while last saturday; about three hours.  I made a cross country to Punta Gorda, and let me tell you, nobody knows a damn thing about what is going on at Charlotte county airport.  Buncha' lazy old bastards flying around there.  There were lots of planes in the pattern at all times, and people entering the pattern anywhere they damn well pleased!  I would be on my base leg, about to turn final, and some old guy would just fly straight into the final right in front of me!  This happened numerous times!  I cannot stress how much of a danger stuff like this is.  People were trying to fly the pattern backwards, for cyring out loud!  Don't get me wrong, I can get a damn good breakfast at PGD, but I was really happy to head back to Venice that day.
Well, next weekend is my FAA written exam, after which I will be fully liscenced.  Who wants to go flying?

-Robby "Only time will tell, and there is no telling when" Coats
Look at my funny face... In fact, its so funny, I think I am going to make it my user image for a while. -Robby "Oh man, I crack myself up" Coats

I hate tampa. Awfully shady place. The USF campus is really nice, though, and damn big. My calsses are rediculous; I have Chem. for Engineers and it's on about a sixth grade level. We've spent the last week or so "learning"...... "LEARNING"(makes quotations motion with fingers in an over emphasized manner)... about what atoms are made of. Wow. The next few classes will discuss what the atomic number and mass means. Worthy of yet another "wow". Parking on campus is rediculous. I was late for my Foundations of Engineering class by 30min just because I couldn't find a parking spot. The good thing, though, is that I will never have to spend the near $200 on a perking permit like everyone else. I only have to pay $3 for parking for the entire time that Im here. I bought one of the $3 one day passes, and I have just been scanning it and changing the date to suit my needs, and it works just fine. The parking Gestapo cant tell the difference. Well, I'm coming home tomorrow for the weekend, like I plan to every weekend because I hate the God Awful place, but everyone else is coming up here, so I guess I will be all alone. Saturday at noon I will be making a cross country flight to somewhere in northern florida... probabally Gainsville or something. The AFROTC here has told me that they will pay for any further advancements to my pilots liscence, so hurray for that. Well, I'm done. -Robby "The ground is for suckers" Coats

To Whom It Might Concern: The deed is done. It is all I had thought about for about three days before I did it; I weighed the possible consequences, and decided that even though the outcome would be the loss of two of the greatest friends I have ever had, it was the right and it had to be done. I hope it was right. I know it must be, for I was trying to stop something that is wrong. In just about any given situation, I know more than anyone thinks I know. What I knew was fact; it does happen and no one will ever convince me otherwise... certainly not be franticly telling me I don't know a damn thing about what was going on. But I do know. Whether or not anyone belives me is irrelevant. I can prove it, but won't. All I intended to do was expose, and that is what I did. Do with the information what you will, for I was done when I started. If I had wanted any further part in anything, don't you think I would have at least signed my name? Nevertheless, the deed is done, and I am no better off for it. I never had the intention of gaining anything out of this, only the posibility of loss. Oh, I know it well. So, now I am deeply saddened because of what I have done to myself, but I belived it had to be done. It hurts hurting those you love, but I could not be aware of such things and just let them go... Are you reading this? The second I put it in the mail, I knew I would never talk to either one of you again. Don't you understand? I knew it. Yet I did it anyway, ignoring the pain, because it was right. I thought that maybe, if I didn't sign my name, I could avoid all of this... A brief, bright flash of dark, and false hope. "Oh well" I suppose. Nothing will ever change... remember that. I suppose I can only find comfort in the fact that I will never do that to anyone, nor am I even capable of it. I was right. Sincerely, Robby
